info.title: MongoClusterManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure management API provides create, read, update, and delete functionality for Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore resources including clusters and firewall rules.

get.description: List the operations for the provider

post.description: Check if mongo cluster name is available for use.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The CheckAvailability request

get.description: List all the mongo clusters in a given subscription.
List all the mongo clusters in a given resource group.
Gets information about a mongo cluster.

parameters.name: mongoClusterName
parameters.description: The name of the mongo cluster.

put.description: Create or update a mongo cluster. Update overwrites all properties for the resource. To only modify some of the properties, use PATCH.

parameters.name: mongoClusterName
parameters.description: The name of the mongo cluster.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Resource create parameters.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

patch.description: Updates an existing mongo cluster. The request body can contain one to many of the properties present in the normal mongo cluster definition.

parameters.name: mongoClusterName
parameters.description: The name of the mongo cluster.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The resource properties to be updated.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

parameters.description: The name of the mongo cluster.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

get.description: List all the replicas for the mongo cluster.

parameters.name: mongoClusterName
parameters.description: The name of the mongo cluster.

Azure.Core.azureLocation.description: Represents an Azure geography region where supported resource providers live.

ConnectionString.description: Connection string for the mongo cluster

CreateMode.description: The mode that the Mongo Cluster is created with.

values.name: Default
values.description: Create a new mongo cluster.

values.name: PointInTimeRestore
values.description: Create a mongo cluster from a restore point-in-time.

values.name: GeoReplica
values.description: Create a replica cluster in distinct geographic region from the source cluster.

values.name: Replica
values.description: Create a replica cluster in the same geographic region as the source cluster.

FirewallRule.description: Represents a mongo cluster firewall rule.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

FirewallRuleListResult.description: The response of a FirewallRule list operation.

value.description: The FirewallRule items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

FirewallRuleProperties.description: The properties of a mongo cluster firewall rule.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the firewall rule.

startIpAddress.description: The start IP address of the mongo cluster firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

endIpAddress.description: The end IP address of the mongo cluster firewall rule. Must be IPv4 format.

ListConnectionStringsResult.description: The connection strings for the given mongo cluster.

connectionStrings.description: An array that contains the connection strings for a mongo cluster.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

MongoClusterListResult.description: The response of a MongoCluster list operation.

value.description: The MongoCluster items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

MongoClusterProperties.description: The properties of a mongo cluster.

createMode.description: The mode to create a mongo cluster.

restoreParameters.description: The parameters to create a point-in-time restore mongo cluster.

replicaParameters.description: The parameters to create a replica mongo cluster.

administratorLogin.description: The administrator's login for the mongo cluster.

administratorLoginPassword.description: The password of the administrator login.

serverVersion.description: The Mongo DB server version. Defaults to the latest available version if not specified.

connectionString.description: The default mongo connection string for the cluster.

earliestRestoreTime.description: Earliest restore timestamp in UTC ISO8601 format.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the mongo cluster.

clusterStatus.description: The status of the mongo cluster.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this mongo cluster.

nodeGroupSpecs.description: The list of node group specs in the cluster.

replica.description: The replication properties for the mongo cluster

infrastructureVersion.description: The infrastructure version the cluster is provisioned on.

sourceResourceId.description: The id of the replication source cluster.

sourceLocation.description: The location of the source cluster

MongoClusterResourceId.description: Identifier for a mongo cluster resource.

pointInTimeUTC.description: UTC point in time to restore a mongo cluster

sourceResourceId.description: Resource ID to locate the source cluster to restore

MongoClusterStatus.description: The status of the Mongo cluster resource.

values.name: Ready
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is ready for use.

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is being provisioned.

values.name: Updating
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is being updated.

values.name: Starting
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is being started.

values.name: Stopping
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is being stopped.

values.name: Stopped
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is stopped.

values.name: Dropping
values.description: The mongo cluster resource is being dropped.

MongoClusterUpdate.description: The type used for update operations of the MongoCluster.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

MongoClusterUpdateProperties.description: The updatable properties of the MongoCluster.

administratorLogin.description: The administrator's login for the mongo cluster.

administratorLoginPassword.description: The password of the administrator login.

serverVersion.description: The Mongo DB server version. Defaults to the latest available version if not specified.

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this mongo cluster.

nodeGroupSpecs.description: The list of node group specs in the cluster.

NodeGroupProperties.description: The properties of the node group on a cluster.

sku.description: The resource sku for the node group. This defines the size of CPU and memory that is provisioned for each node. Example values: 'M30', 'M40'.

diskSizeGB.description: The disk storage size for the node group in GB. Example values: 128, 256, 512, 1024.

enableHa.description: Whether high availability is enabled on the node group.

sku.description: The resource sku for the node group. This defines the size of CPU and memory that is provisioned for each node. Example values: 'M30', 'M40'.

diskSizeGB.description: The disk storage size for the node group in GB. Example values: 128, 256, 512, 1024.

enableHa.description: Whether high availability is enabled on the node group.

kind.description: The node type deployed in the node group.

nodeCount.description: The number of nodes in the node group.

NodeKind.description: The kind of the node on the cluster.

values.name: Shard
values.description: The node is a shard kind.

PreviewFeature.description: Preview features that can be enabled on a mongo cluster.

values.name: GeoReplicas
values.description: Enables geo replicas preview feature. The feature must be set at create-time on new cluster to enable linking a geo-replica cluster to it.

PrivateEndpointConnectionResource.description: Concrete proxy resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

PrivateEndpointConnectionResourceListRes.description: The response of a PrivateEndpointConnectionResource list operation.

value.description: The PrivateEndpointConnectionResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PrivateLinkResource.description: Concrete proxy resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

PrivateLinkResourceListResult.description: The response of a PrivateLinkResource list operation.

value.description: The PrivateLinkResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PromoteMode.description: The mode to apply to a promote operation.

values.name: Switchover
values.description: Promotion will switch the current replica cluster to the primary role and the original primary will be switched to a replica role, maintaining the replication link.

PromoteOption.description: The option to apply to a promote operation.

values.name: Forced
values.description: Promote option forces the promotion without waiting for the replica to be caught up to the primary. This can result in data-loss so should only be used during disaster recovery scenarios.

promoteOption.description: The promote option to apply to the operation.

mode.description: The mode to apply to the promote operation. Value is optional and default value is 'Switchover'.

ProvisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the last accepted operation.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Resource has been created.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Resource creation failed.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: Resource creation was canceled.

values.name: InProgress
values.description: An operation is in-progress on the resource.

values.name: Updating
values.description: An update operation is in-progress on the resource.

values.name: Dropping
values.description: A drop operation is in-progress on the resource.

PublicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public endpoint access is allowed for this Mongo cluster.  Value is optional and default value is 'Enabled'

values.name: Enabled
values.description: If set, mongo cluster can be accessed through private and public methods.

values.name: Disabled
values.description: If set, the private endpoints are the exclusive access method.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

ReplicaListResult.description: The response of a Replica list operation.

value.description: The Replica items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ReplicationProperties.description: Replica properties of the mongo cluster.

sourceResourceId.description: The resource id the source cluster for the replica cluster.

role.description: The replication role of the cluster

replicationState.description: The replication link state of the replica cluster.

ReplicationRole.description: Replication role of the mongo cluster.

values.name: Primary
values.description: The cluster is a primary replica.

values.name: AsyncReplica
values.description: The cluster is a local asynchronous replica.

values.name: GeoAsyncReplica
values.description: The cluster is a geo-asynchronous replica.

ReplicationState.description: The state of the replication link between the replica and source cluster.

values.name: Active
values.description: Replication link is active.

values.name: Catchup
values.description: Replica is catching-up with the primary. This can occur after the replica is created or after a promotion is triggered.

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: Replica and replication link to the primary is being created.

values.name: Updating
values.description: Replication link is being updated due to a change on the replica or an upgrade.

values.name: Broken
values.description: Replication link is broken and the replica may need to be recreated.

values.name: Reconfiguring
values.description: Replication link is re-configuring due to a promotion event.
